attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
·       A physical stock count of raw materials and finished product was conducted on 3 March 2025 to determine whether the stocks movement was well managed and to assess the effectiveness of existing Stock management controls.

·       The exercise showed that:

ü  Polybags had a variance of +2,721 Pieces

ü  The finished product had a variance of +28.5 pieces, there was also a pending deduction of 63 pieces of 400g that had not been booked in the system.

ü  White flour and brown flour had a variance of -2.24 kgs and +8.51 kgs respectively.

ü  The other stock items had immaterial variances as illustrated below:
attributes.recommendation: The branch management to strengthen their Stock controls to eliminate or reduce the noted variances
attributes.effect: The variances noted imply that stock management controls need to be strengthened.

value: Raw material variations were minimal, Positive variations in polybags are due to gauging used sometimes it comes in excess.

·       Raw material variations were minimal, Positive variations in polybags are due to gauge used sometimes it come in excess.

Positive variation in Utto was caused by less consumption.

·       In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025, stock was as seen below:

ü  Polybags +607 pieces

ü  Finished product -55 pieces

ü  White flour +12.54 Kgs.
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Crates Verification
attributes.description:
·       A review of the crate balances at Crater branch on 3 March 2025 was done to establish whether the controls for crates movement were operating effectively.

·       It was noted that crates had a nil variance with both book and system records, however the branch had an opening balance of 89 crates as seen below:
attributes.recommendation: The crates movement was well controlled; however, the route crate balances imply the weakening of controls for crates’ collection.
attributes.effect: The crates movement was well controlled; however, the route crate balances imply the weakening of controls for crates’ collection.

value: Sales to work on reducing supermarket crates balances, route crates balances are not allowed, I will do a follow-up to ensure they are returned daily.
Sales to work on reducing supermarket crates balance, for route customers crates balances are not allowed manager to ensure they are returned daily.
In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025, crates had nil variations.
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
·       The cash held at the cashier's office was verified on 3 March 2025 to ensure that the cash balances matched the cash-flow records and that the established cash operation standards were followed.

·       It was noted that cash had an immaterial negative Variance of Ksh 20.75, however the branch had Pending IOUS worth Kshs 28,000 out of which 3 for date 19/02/2025,18/02/2025 and 19/02/2025 worth KES 22,000 were past the 3-day clearance policy. 

·       Below is the summary of the cash verification.

Table 3:Cash verification summary.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The branch management controls to be strengthened especially on management of IOUS.
attributes.effect:
·       The minimal variances noted in cash balances imply that cash controls are working effectively.

·       The IOUS that are past the clearing dates implies that controls over management of IOUS are weak and need to be strengthened.

value: Cash controls need to be strengthened, for the pending IOUS they are handled by the transport department they will facilitate clearance. We will follow up with HQ.
Cash controls need to be strengthened, for the pending IOUS they are handled by the transport department they will facilitate clearance. We will follow up with HQ.
In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025, it was noted that cash a negligible variance of -0.75
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread weights
attributes.description:
·       Packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market were randomly weighed to determine if they were of correct weight of 200g,400g,600g ,800g and 1.5 Kg as per the KEBS requirements.

·       Underweights were noted across all the varieties as seen below:

ü  600 g Naivas white bread had 77.6%.

ü  600g CTW/BT had 76%.

ü  800CTW 46.7%.

ü  400 g CT/BT 48.7%.

ü  600g Barrel had 21.4%.

·       Below is the detailed summary of the audit findings.

Table 4:Bread Weight Check
attributes.recommendation: The branch management adheres to the set weight ranges and quality standards to ensure compliance to the recommended weight.
attributes.effect: Presence of underweight and overweight bread signified lapses in implementation of the set dough weight and failure to adhere to the correct bread production process.

value:
·       Underweights were caused by Over proofing, Oven men who are still training /new they are overbaking bread.

·       Packers are slow, leading to bread overcooling resulting in underweight.We will follow up on the person concerned and action will be taken, for the issue to be resolved. We will also improve on bread overcooling by ensuring efficiencies are achieved.
·       Correct operating procedures should be followed, Random spot checks on dough weight should also be done.For employees who are negligent, we will institute disciplinary action.

·       In the previous audit report dated 26th January 2025, underweights were as seen below:

ü  400g CTW had 41%

ü  600g Barrel had 7%

ü  600 CTW/BT 35%

                800 CTW 53%
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis was done on the bread damages for both production and market-based deformities for the period of 35 days from 26 January to 1 March 2025 to detect if the quality standards set for the branch were being followed.

·       We noted the following:

ü  Production damages stood at 0.23% of total production, which exceeded the set limit of 0.2%

ü  Market damages stood at 0.58% of total sales, which was above the set limit of 0.5% as demonstrated in the table below:

Table 5:Production damages.

NB: The analysis is exclusive of 72 pieces of oven damages and 2,456 deduction damages

Table 6:Market Damages.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Enhance controls within the production process to ensure bread produced is of good quality thereby minimizing the possibility of excess production and market damages.Follow up on good handling practices of bread in transit

value:
·       We will control bread quality by ensuring the correct production process is adhered to, especially baking to ensure minimal production damages.

We will also ensure that bread sent to the market is of good quality to minimize excess market returns and ensure customers reduce bread mishandling.

·       We will control bread quality by ensuring the correct production process is adhered to, especially in baking to ensure minimal production damages.

We will also ensure that bread sent to the market is of good quality to minimize excess market returns and ensure customers reduce bread mishandling.

·       In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025, Production damages stood at 0.2162% while market damages stood at 0.89%.Damages sent to ingredient had -17.4 kgs which was equivalent to 43.5 loaves converted to 400g.
Current

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description:
1.     Production Efficiency

Findings.

·       A review of the branch’s management of human capital resources availed to the production section was done for a period of 35 days from 26 January 2025-1 March 2025, to determine if the allocation of production workers was optimal as per the Company’s set standards.

·       It was noted that the production efficiency was at 4.35 bags per production worker which was within the standard of 4.3.

·       The results were as detailed below:

Table 7:Production Efficiency.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to maintain production efficiency and improve further
attributes.effect: Production workers were being fully utilized.

value: Production efficiency will be maintained and improved further.
Production efficiency will be maintained and improved further.
In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025, production efficiency was at 4.2 bags per production worker, 20 extra workers were hired with a cost implication of Kes 21,730.
Current

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
·       A review packing efficiency for a period of 35 days from 26 January 2025-1 March 2025 was done to determine if packers were achieving their standard efficiency of 97 crates per packer.

·       It was noted that packing efficiency was at 86.22 crates per packer which was below the standard set of 97 crates per packer, Extra cost of KES 38,304 was incurred for hiring extra 42 workers.

Table 8: Packing Efficiency.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management to ensure optimal allocation of packers based on the set standards/Workers allocation to be done as per the prior shift targets.
attributes.effect: Packers did not attain their packing efficiency; an extra 42 workers were hired with a cost implication of KES 38,304.

value: I will do a follow up to ensure every shift achieve their set target
Alot of controls are required, shift supervisors to take accurate stock of bread packed and packers to be pushed to ensure they are achieving the targets.
In the previous audit it was noted that packing efficiency was at 95.42 crates per packer,4 extra workers were hired with a cost implication of Ksh.3,648.
Current

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of both the mixing chart and mixing chart summaries for the period of 35 days from 26 January 2025-1 March 2025 was done to determine if the raw materials’ consumption were as per the set BOM and if the set yield and quality standards were achieved for production.

·       We noted the following:

ü  Average yield was 191.46 loaves per bag

ü  Average production was 73.06 bags equivalent to 75.32% of the set branch production capacity of 97 bags.

ü  Utto units’ consumption to bags of flour ratio was 1:1

ü   No remixes were noted for the audit period.

Table 9: Mixing Chart Analysis.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The branch management to work on improving sales to enhance production target achievement.
attributes.effect: The branch production capacity is not fully utilized by 24.68% of 97 bags, this implies that there is need for improvement.

value: Average yield is within the range, Production target is sometimes affected by available orders, this leads to production control
Production target is affected by sales, we produce as per orders received and sometimes oven breakdowns.

·       In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025,

ü  Average yield was at 191.47 loaves

ü  Average production was 67.46 bags which was equivalent to 69.19% of the target of 97.50 bags set.

ü  Utto consumption to bags was 1:1

ü  48 Cases of remixes were noted.
Current

attributes.title: Generator Fuel consumption
attributes.description:
1.     Generator fuel consumption.

Findings.

·       An analysis of generator fuel consumption was done for a period of 28 days from 1 February to 28 February 2025 to check if consumption were as per standard rates.

·       It was noted that fuel consumption was at 18.33 l/h which was within the Standard range.

Table 10:Generator fuel consumption.
attributes.recommendation: Generator fuel consumption controls to be maintained.
attributes.effect: Generator fuel consumption was within range.

value: Generator fuel controls to be maintained
Generator fuel controls to be maintained
·        N/A
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Debtors analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of the debtors’ balances as of 2 February 2025 was performed to identify if there were any instances of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

·       It was noted that outstanding closing balances as at date 2 March 2025 were Kshs. 741,762.46, out of this most were institutions and a few customers whose security deposits were above the debt.

·       There were also 3 blacklisted/Dormant customers highlighted in green amounting to Kshs.24,623.22.

A detailed summary of debtor’s balances is illustrated below in Appendix 1
attributes.recommendation: ·       Sales rep to follow up on the outstanding balances to be cleared.
attributes.effect: The presence of debt balances implies that there is a risk of bad debts if not followed upon and could result in cash flow issues.

value:
·       Most pending balances are those of institutions, cash customers are okey they sometimes take two days to clear.

For dormant customers Sales rep to follow up to ensure the amounts are recovered and be removed from the system.

·       Most pending balances are those of institutions, cash customers are okey they sometimes take two days to clear.For dormant customers Sales rep to follow up to ensure the amounts are recovered and be removed from the system.

In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025, a total of Kshs.176,545 outstanding balances were noted which were under sales rep follow up. There were 3 blacklisted customers with a total balance of Ksh 24,623.
Current

attributes.title: Vehicles fuel consumption
attributes.description: ·       A review was conducted on the branch vehicles’ fuel consumption vis a vis the set standard consumption rate to determine if there was optimal utilization of fuel for the period of 28 days from 1 February 2025-28 February 2025.It was noted that all route vehicles’ fuel consumptions were within the set standard except for 2 vehicles, one Vehicle for Kericho 1 route that consumed more 23 .43 litrers (Was fueled to Nairobi for repairs) and for west crater supermarket that was saving more but was noted that it had faulty speedometer, but the issue has been reported to KAF
attributes.recommendation: ·       Maintain and enhance the fuel management controls within the branch.The branch should also follow up with KAF to ensure repairs for faulty speedometer is done.
attributes.effect: All route vehicles’ fuel consumption was well controlled.

value: Fuel consumption to be well maintained, follow up with KAF will be done to act on the faulty speedometer.
Fuel consumption to be well maintained, follow up with KAF will be done to act on the faulty speedometer.
In the prior audit report dated 26th January 2025, it was noted that fuel consumption was within the set standard rates.
Current
